label.label3: Solve the puzzle to discover where you can enjoy this delicious traditional dish!

review.title: HISTORICAL REVIEW
review.paragraph1: Rumiñahui Canton originally belonged to the Metropolitan District of Quito and was considered a parish.
review.paragraph2: However, on May 31, 1938, General Alberto Enríquez Gallo elevated the parish of Sangolquí to the category of an autonomous canton.
review.paragraph3: Its name honors the Indigenous hero Rumiñahui, a symbol of courage for all Ecuadorians.
review.paragraph4: A group of citizens formed a civic committee that promoted the creation of Rumiñahui Canton. Thanks to their efforts, the people of Sangolquí and surrounding areas achieved cantonization 87 years ago.

elements.rumiñahui: Stone face — an emblematic figure known for his historical deeds.

monuments.title: MAIN MONUMENTS
monuments.paragraph1: Its body features multicolored tones: green reflects nature’s constant renewal; black represents the earth; yellow, orange, and gold symbolize the energy of the sun; crimson evokes struggle, effort, and blood; and dark blue expresses energy and health.
monuments.paragraph2: Endara Crown portrayed the golden food of the gods using the naïve technique, highlighting the fertility of the Valle de los Chillos.
monuments.paragraph3: The sculpture represents a farmer who, during his rest, searches for water but seems unable to find it, reflecting effort and need.
monuments.paragraph4: A central monolith that functions as a sundial and pays tribute to ancestral traditions related to agricultural cycles, representing solstices and equinoxes.

data.ubi: The parish of Cotogchoa is located southwest of Rumiñahui Canton.
